title: Smelling in stereo—a surprising find on a fossilized shark
description: Fossils and modern experiments are telling us what a shark's nose knows.

title: Musk’s X Corp. threatens to sue Meta over Twitter “copycat” Threads
description: X Corp. claims Meta used Twitter trade secrets and ex-employees to build Threads.

title: Octopuses sleep—and possibly dream—just like humans
description: The cephalopods experience an apparent sleep state with REM-like activity.

title: Threads attracts 30M users in 24 hours despite design flaws, privacy concerns
description: FTC requires Meta to make it easy for users to control data.

title: Mastodon fixes critical “TootRoot” vulnerability allowing node hijacking
description: Most critical of the bugs allowed attackers to root federated instances.

title: CDC is slashing funding for states’ childhood vaccination data systems
description: The budget cut targets data systems that can identify areas with low vaccination.

title: Android phone hits 24GB of RAM, as much as a 13-inch MacBook Pro
description: The Nubia RedMagic 8S Pro+ gaming phone sports a huge spec sheet.

title: State Dept. cancels election meetings with Facebook after “free speech” ruling
description: US aims to block injunction after judge ruled White House coerced social networks.

title: Review: Forcite’s MK1S smart helmet stays on your head, not in your face
description: After many failed concepts, we find a smart helmet that actually works well.

title: Volkswagen will start testing its driverless ID. Buzz in Austin, Texas
description: The program will start with 10 ID. Buzzes with autonomous tech from Mobileye.

title: June extremes suggest parts of climate system are reaching tipping points
description: Research shows heat domes, wildfires, and vanishing polar ice are the symptoms.

title: India, a growing space power, is forging closer ties with NASA
description: Details of a potential US-Indian partnership in human spaceflight remain murky.
